sense.name: an interconnected system of computers
sense.examples: John set up a local area net in his house. You can probably find that antique book somewhere for sale on the Net. I check the local weather on the Net every morning. Personal data should always be encrypted when sending it over the Net. The new website gives that firm a compelling Net presence.

sense.name: a mesh trap to catch creatures
sense.examples: The fishermen laid their nets out in the calm waters of the bay. Have you ever caught butterflies with a net? He was caught in a net of lies. (metaphoric) The terrorist escaped the nets of several governments. (metaphoric) The huge scallop nets used by some fishing vessels destroy the ocean floor ecology.

sense.name: profit, revenues minus cost
sense.examples: The firm's net income last quarter exceeded two million dollars. What was the net at the box office last night? His father's net estate after taxes was only a few thousand dollars.

sense.name: equipment in sports games
sense.examples: The ball hit the net on the first serve. That goalie never lets a ball touch his net. John helped take down the volleyball nets after the picnic.

sense.name: mesh fabric
sense.examples: Sally wore green net stockings to work yesterday. Those food workers wear hair nets and gloves. We slept in hammocks that were rope woven into nets.
